snippet: Amar’e Stoudemire of the Knicks is the latest in a long line of professional athletes to fight an inanimate object — a fire extinguisher — and lose.
abstract: New York Knicks forward Amar'e Stoudemire, who injured his hand after punching a fire extinguisher case after team's 104-94 playoff loss to Miami Heat, joins a long list of professional athletes, many with New York connections, who lost bouts with walls, doors, water coolers and other clubhouse furnishings because of unchecked anger.
lead_paragraph: Amar’e Stoudemire of the Knicks is the latest in a long line of professional athletes to fight an inanimate object — a fire extinguisher — and lose.

headline.seo: Stoudemire Loses His Head and Knicks Lose Stoudemire
headline.main: Anger Mismanagement: Volcanic Athletes and Impetuous Acts
